subject: Re: [junit] Whether I must extends TestCase?
msgSnippet: I have found one case where extending a production class with a test class to be useful.  In a web environment under .Net you have the notion of a code-behind.

I have found one case where extending a production class with a test
class =
to be useful.  In a web environment under .Net you have the
notion of a cod=
e-behind.  This code-behind represents in code the page
which will be serve=
d to the browser (so you have Table, Button and
Form objects).

From a test=
ing perspective it is much more natural for our team to
call the page's met=
hods in a similar fashion as the web contrainer
would.

Examples include th=
e OnInit(), Page_Load() and
buttonDoSomething_click() methods.

duction code, and not the other way around. Why
